parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.16</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> DLC </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns array of appIDs of DLCs.</value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[getDLCs]] filter </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value>  filter: [[Number]] - can be:<br>
0 - all<br>
1 - owned<br>
2 - not owned.<br> </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - array of DLC numbers (see above) </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_ownedDLCs = [[getDLCs]] 1;</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_hasKarts = (288520 [[in]] ([[getDLCs]] 1));</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[getObjectDLC]], [[getPersonUsedDLCs]], [[getMissionDLCs]], [[getDLCAssetsUsageByName]], [[getDLCAssetsUsage]], [[getAssetDLCInfo]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style='display:none'>Notes</h3>
<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on April 7, 2015 - 20:27 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Benargee|Benargee]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
To add to the note above, app ID can be found in CfgMods. Here is an example path from zeus using the Splendid Config Viewer:
<code>[[configFile]] >> "CfgMods" >> "Curator" >> "appId"</code>
This method can be used to find app IDs without having to find a list like the one above.<br>
I am also pretty sure you are able to define your own app ID for your own mods using this method.
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes -->
</comment>
